decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost, efficient creatures like Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Nivmagus Elemental to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Grim Lavamancer while disrupting the opponent's plans with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Snare. By consistently deploying threats and protecting them with countermagic, this deck aims to outpace and overwhelm the opponent, securing victory through aggressive gameplay and careful resource management.

This deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo as quickly as possible to create a 20/20 flying indestructible Marit Lage token. The key cards in this deck are Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage, which can be combined with cards like Crop Rotation to bring out Marit Lage in just a few turns. Support cards like Mox Diamond, Thoughtseize, and Abrupt Decay help to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to control the game while setting up the Dark Depths combo for a quick win.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Stoneforge Mystic while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Mirran Crusader and Flickerwisp. The deck also aims to control the opponent's resources with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port, while protecting its own creatures with Mother of Runes. The deck utilizes the Death & Taxes strategy of disrupting the opponent's mana base and deploying disruptive creatures to control the game and come out ahead in the aggro matchup.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana through rituals and Lion's Eye Diamond to cast a high storm count spell like Tendrils of Agony. Cards like Brainstorm and Preordain help to find key pieces while Thoughtseize and Duress disrupt the opponent. Past in Flames allows for recursion and Infernal Tutor provides additional tutoring. The goal is to assemble the necessary pieces to quickly generate a high storm count and win the game with Tendrils of Agony. The deck aims to win the game in a single turn through efficient mana usage and careful planning.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain control of the game by utilizing counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck focuses on card advantage through efficient draw spells like Accumulated Knowledge and can manipulate the top of the deck with Counterbalance. Terminus is used as a board wipe option, while Entreat the Angels can provide a win condition. Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor offer additional value and flexibility in controlling the pace of the game. The deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck aims to quickly deploy threats like Young Pyromancer, Delver of Secrets, and True-Name Nemesis while disrupting the opponent with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. It also utilizes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Forked Bolt to control the board. The mana base is optimized with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to all colors. The key strategy is to apply early pressure and maintain tempo advantage over the opponent, utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the game.

The deck focuses on using the "Show and Tell" card to put powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play for free. It uses cards like Sneak Attack and Omniscience to cheat these creatures into play quickly, overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to react. The deck also includes a package of blue counter spells and cantrips to protect its combo pieces and find them when needed. This deck aims to win the game quickly by leveraging powerful creatures and spells to create an insurmountable advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Dark Depths combo as quickly as possible by utilizing cards such as Thespian's Stage, Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Expedition Map. The goal is to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token by removing all ice counters from Dark Depths with cards like Vampire Hexmage. The deck also includes various disruption and protection spells like Thoughtseize, Duress, Pithing Needle, and Sylvan Safekeeper to prevent opponents from interfering with the combo. Additionally, the deck includes mana acceleration cards like Lotus Petal and Elvish Spirit Guide to help ramp into the combo pieces.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly set up a powerful combo by using cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience to cheat out big creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand onto the battlefield. The deck also includes a variety of control spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with these powerful creatures and win the game in a few quick turns.

The key strategy of this deck is to assemble the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's deck. This is supported by disruption cards like Red Elemental Blast and Pyroblast to protect the combo, along with Ethersworn Canonist to slow down the opponent's spells. Imperial Recruiter is used to tutor for combo pieces or utility creatures, while cards like Goblin Welder and Goblin Cratermaker offer additional removal or recursion options. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up its win condition.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game by using powerful control cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Spell Pierce. The deck also aims to quickly put pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and True-Name Nemesis. Additionally, the deck utilizes Stoneforge Mystic to tutor up powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull to further strengthen its board presence. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through a mix of disruption, card advantage, and efficient threats.

The deck focuses on using lands as a control strategy, utilizing cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to generate powerful threats. Gamble and Life from the Loam provide card advantage and consistency, while cards like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter disrupt the opponent's mana base. Engineered Explosives and Punishing Fire offer removal options, while Exploration accelerates land drops. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by constantly recurring lands from the graveyard and creating a lock with cards like The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive early game plays with efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Delver of Secrets, supported by cheap and versatile spells like Lightning Bolt and Vapor Snag. The deck aims to control the board with counter spells like Force of Will and Daze while maintaining card advantage with cantrips like Brainstorm and Preordain. The mana base is streamlined for consistency and speed, allowing for quick tempo plays to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay using cheap and efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Monastery Swiftspear, backed up by a suite of burn spells such as Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect its threats and counter opposing spells. The mana base is optimized for speed and consistency, with a focus on red and blue mana sources to support the deck's aggressive playstyle.

The key concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly deploy threats such as True-Name Nemesis, Gurmag Angler, and Delver of Secrets while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Force of Will. The deck also aims to control the board with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Wasteland, while maintaining card advantage through cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder. By combining aggression with disruption and card selection, this deck looks to overwhelm opponents and secure victory through tempo and efficient resource management.

The main focus of this Aggro Death & Taxes deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through various tax effects while applying pressure with efficient creatures. Cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Sanctum Prelate make it difficult for the opponent to cast spells, while disruptive creatures like Phyrexian Revoker shut down key opposing cards. The deck also utilizes powerful equipment such as Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice to enhance its creatures and close out games quickly. With mana denial tools like Wasteland and Rishadan Port, the deck aims to control the game and secure victory.
